channel.title: Configuring new application for Tor in Whonix-Workstation
channel.description:
For work, I use charting software. Before Whonix, I'd install the program and configure it to use SOCKS v5 : 9150 to get the stream via Tor. I've now installed that program in Whonix-Workstation.
- Do I still need to configure it for Tor proxy or no... Since it is forced through Whonix-Gateway anyway (therefore Tor)?
- If I did configure it as before (SOCKS v5 : 9150), would that, then, cause a Tor-over-Tor scenario?
Thank you.

item.title: Configuring new application for Tor in Whonix-Workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
- Do I still need to configure it for Tor proxy or no... Since it is forced through Whonix-Gateway anyway (therefore Tor)?
Always though Tor so or so. However, configuring SocksPorts is useful for stream isolation. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation)
- If I did configure it as before (SOCKS v5 : 9150), would that, then, cause a Tor-over-Tor scenario?
No. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor)

Read full topic
item.source: Configuring new application for Tor in Whonix-Workstation
